column5: We are using Kay Air out of Ear Falls for the first time. We are going to Casummit Lake Outpost which is around 75 miles NE of their Ear Falls base. Any one use this outfitter? Any one fish this lake? If so, what can we expect to find? Thanks, Ron Wagner

We used Kay-Air a couple years ago and we went to that lake. Peter Kay runs a great operation. The Cabin was fairly new and clean. Peter is a great pilot and we had a great time. There was another lake connected to that lake that we portaged to. That lake seemed to have bigger Walley on it. Send me your e-mail and I can give you more information about the lake the camp. Ivy

I have not stayed at one of their camps, but did use the air service once. Seemed like a top-notched operation.
